children.name: Java
children.description: Object-oriented language used for building cross-platform applications and backend systems.

children.name: Python
children.description: Versatile high-level programming language popular in data science, web development, and scripting.

children.name: C
children.description: Low-level programming language used for systems programming and performance-critical applications.

children.name: Go
children.description: Compiled language known for simplicity and concurrency, commonly used in backend development.

children.name: JavaScript (Node.js, React.js)
children.description: Dynamic scripting language used for interactive web applications and full-stack development.

children.name: Numpy
children.description: Library for numerical computing with support for large multi-dimensional arrays and matrices.

children.name: Pandas
children.description: Data analysis and manipulation library built on top of NumPy, ideal for handling structured data.

children.name: Pomegranate
children.description: Probabilistic modeling library for Bayesian networks, HMMs, and other models.

children.name: TensorFlow
children.description: End-to-end open-source platform for machine learning and deep learning.

children.name: skLearn
children.description: Machine learning library offering simple and efficient tools for data mining and analysis.

children.name: PyTorch
children.description: Deep learning framework that emphasizes flexibility and dynamic computation graphs.

children.name: Django
children.description: High-level Python web framework that promotes rapid development and clean design.

children.name: HTML
children.description: Standard markup language for creating and structuring content on the web.

children.name: CSS
children.description: Stylesheet language used for describing the presentation of HTML documents.

children.name: SQLite
children.description: Lightweight, file-based relational database often used in embedded systems and prototyping.

children.name: MySQL
children.description: Open-source relational database management system widely used in web applications.

children.name: PostgreSQL
children.description: Advanced open-source relational database known for robustness and standards compliance.

children.name: Git
children.description: Version control system for tracking changes in source code during development.

children.name: Unix
children.description: Powerful, multitasking operating system used for servers, development, and scripting.

children.name: IntelliJ
children.description: Popular IDE for Java development offering smart code completion and deep code analysis.

children.name: PyCharm
children.description: IDE for Python development providing code analysis and a range of productivity tools.

children.name: VSCode
children.description: Lightweight yet powerful source code editor with extensive extension support.

children.name: Eclipse
children.description: IDE primarily for Java development, known for its plugin ecosystem.

children.name: XCode
children.description: IDE for developing applications for Apple's platforms like iOS and macOS.

children.name: Vim
children.description: Highly configurable text editor known for its efficiency and keyboard-based navigation.

children.name: Micro
children.description: Terminal-based text editor that aims to be easy to use and intuitive.

children.name: Jupyter Lab
children.description: Web-based interactive development environment for notebooks, code, and data visualization.

children.name: ObservableHQ
children.description: Platform for interactive JavaScript notebooks focused on data visualization.

children.name: Adobe InDesign
children.description: Desktop publishing software used for creating layouts for print and digital media.

children.name: Illustrator
children.description: Vector graphics editor used for illustrations, logos, and complex graphic designs.

children.name: Photoshop
children.description: Industry-standard software for image editing and graphic design.

children.name: Premiere
children.description: Video editing software used for film, television, and web video production.
